timeline.bodyText: From DB-9388, I learnt that for rows in dictionary table, partial row update does not seem to work well. To be safe, we should read all the columns of the row, and also provide the complete update row for update. That is, set all the bits for both columnToReadSet and columnToUpdateSet.

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we use the check "rowTemplate[I] == null"? I think we only have problem when this field is not populated at all, and thus null. Do we have a problem if rowTemplate[I] has a NULL value?
timeline.author: yxia92

replies.bodyText:
The problem we’re facing here is that we store null in a non-nullable column. The column type is defined as the following:
SystemColumnImpl.getColumn("JAVACLASSNAME", java.sql.Types.LONGVARCHAR, false /*isNullable?*/, Integer.MAX_VALUE)
Later on, we create a DVD and store a null into it:
row.setColumn(SYSALIASES_JAVACLASSNAME, dvf.getLongvarcharDataValue(javaClassName)); // javaClassName is null
I think this is causing the decoder to be confused leading to corrupted decoded data since we send null value in a non-nullable field.
To solve this problem, I made sure that we’re writing "NULL" literal leaving no chance for the field to be null.
I think the interesting part is we can provide a much simpler solution by simply making the column nullable! i.e. it is a one-liner change from:
SystemColumnImpl.getColumn("JAVACLASSNAME", java.sql.Types.LONGVARCHAR, false /*isNullable?*/, Integer.MAX_VALUE)
to
SystemColumnImpl.getColumn("JAVACLASSNAME", java.sql.Types.LONGVARCHAR, true /*isNullable?*/, Integer.MAX_VALUE)
This makes the decoder happy and everything works as expected (just tested it). Moreover, I don’t think we need an upgrade script for it.
However it means that we will have to change the SYSALIASES schema. Not sure if this is something we want to do, that’s why I lean towards the proposed solution in this PR.
